bioghist.p: The Poor Richard Club was a Philadelphia social and professional organization for those in the advertising business ("it is composed of men who buy advertising, men who make advertising, men who sell advertising"). It was formed in 1904, and in 1907 established its location at 239 Camac Street in Philadelphia. Beginning in 1934, the club awarded its Gold Medal of Achievement to notable business and political figures. The club was associated with the Charles Morris Price School of Advertising and Journalism.

scopecontent.p: This is the Poor Richard Club visitor's register from 1907 to 1925. Visitors entered their name, the date, their residence, and the name of the member accompanying them to the club.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
